newsitem.title: SOUTH AFRICA: CRICKET-SOUTH AFRICA TURN THE SCREWS ON INDIA.
newsitem.headline: CRICKET-SOUTH AFRICA TURN THE SCREWS ON INDIA.

text.p: Half-centuries from Andrew Hudson, Daryll Cullinan and Brian McMillan put South Africa into an almost impregnable position in the second test against India at Newlands on Sunday.
At tea on the fourth day they had reached 246 for six in their second innings, an overall lead of 416.
After the early loss of nightwatchman Lance Klusener for 12 which reduced them to 33 for three, South Africa recovered well through two good partnerships.
First, Hudson and Cullinan, who both made 55, added 94 for the fourth wicket before Cullinan played inside a leg-break from Anil Kumble and was bowled.
India then collected two more wickets as Hudson played on to Javagal Srinath and captain Hansie Cronje became Kumble's second victim when he was caught at short-leg by Rahul Dravid for 18.
At 155 for six, South Africa were again in a degree of trouble but an unbroken partnership of 91 between McMillan and Shaun Pollock re-established their command.
McMillan was 58 not out at the interval while Pollock had 33.
With the declaration imminent it left India facing the likely task of having to bat for the best part of four sessions to avoid going 2-0 in the three test series.
South Africa won the first test in Durban by 328 runs.
